value.0: Vhorkas wishes to speak with you, <boy/girl>... I, on the other hand, do not. Go to the Overlord with your incessant prattling...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_2_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 2. >>
Vhorkas wishes to speak with you before we depart, <FirstName>, so do so quickly! We must set out after the Crimson Prophet as quickly as possible!
We have no time for words, <boy/girl>! We must set out to stop the Prophet at once!
I shall have vengeance on the Crimson Prophet! I swear it!
Speak with Markius, <FullName>. We have little time, and he has an important matter to discuss with you.
We must stop the Crimson Prophet's plans, <FirstName>! He must not escape Ghaarak with that orb...

<StartAction>[This man, one of the two men you saw speaking to your father shortly before his death, appears to be trapped within a strange globe of energy, emitted by the Control Stone. His eyes slowly move towards yours...]</Start>
<StartAction>[The man's eyes grow wide as he turns his gaze to you.]</Start> <FullName>, you're alive! I... I heard what happened to your father, and... and I suppose I assumed you met the same fate.
I am Harkon, a High Sorcerer of the Sharakhan Empire. I was here in Ghaarak tracking the movements of the foul being known as the Crimson Prophet...
<StartAction>[A smoldering anger seems to light in Harkon's eyes.]</Start> But the Prophet has bested me! He has used the magic of the Control Stone to trap me within this cage.
He has sealed himself away in the Imperial Treasury. From what I have gathered, your father found an ancient relic, one that may prove extremely dangerous... in the wrong hands.
I must be freed of this cage, and stop the Prophet's plans! You must help me escape before the Prophet recovers this relic from the Imperial Treasury!
Your father and I have been... acquaintances... for a long time, <FirstName>. Okaris sent word to me of a gem he had found, but he seemed unwilling to speak of it any great length.
Your father did not seem himself after recovering this gem, and I began to suspect it may have taken some sort of influence over him. I fear now that my suspicions will prove true...

Your father was a fool not to come to us sooner... a mistake I imagine he would sorely regret, were he still alive, that is. Now, this gem may fall into the hands of the Crimson Prophet, to be used for all manner of atrocities...
<StartAction>[Harkon sneers at your mistrust.]</Start> You are proving to be as difficult as your father, <FirstName>... but we have little time! The Prophet may emerge from the Treasury at any time!
You may trust Harkon, <lad/lass>. He may seem a bit rough around the edges, but he and I are close allies, often working together against the Crimson Prophet's dark plans...
Harkon can be trusted, <FirstName>. He may not always have the kindest tongue, but he is an ally of mine, dedicated to stopping the Crimson Prophet's evil...

You will need to somehow stop the sorcery of the Control Stone. I could easily master its power if I were free, but my current situation complicates matters. It seems you will have to deal with the stone, <FirstName>.

From what I know of it, the Control Stone is operated by a rather simple conjuration phrase, which calls its power forth. However, to utilize its magic, you will also need to bypass its runes of protection.
However, I know neither the conjuration words nor the method of deactivating its defenses. Perhaps you should have a look around the Grand Hall, and see what you can find...
Or, you could simply try and crush the pedestals operating the stone. Doing so may disrupt the sorceries in place, though, so be wary.
Be quick about it, <FirstName>! I must be free of the Control Stone's power before the Crimson Prophet emerges from the Treasury!

<StartAction>[Harkon gives you a dark glance.]</Start> I suggest you stop this foolishness now, for if the Prophet emerges and I am not here to aid you, I believe you may find an end to your life much sooner than you would wish...
Now get to it, and do not waste any further time wagging your tongue at me!
I know quite a great deal about you, <FirstName>. My associates and I have been keeping a close eye on the <CUSTOM6001> of Okaris <LastName> for a long while now...

<StartAction>[You see a rather strange expression pass over this man's face, one which almost resembles relief...]</Start> That is sad news, <lad/lass>, but there is no time to grieve for the dead at the moment...
<StartAction>[Suddenly, the imprisoned man speaks.]</Start> Markius! Thank the gods you are here! What kept you so long?

I was aiding the Imperial citizens in finding a place of safety. Harkon, the Crimson Prophet's followers are ravaging the city... Magistrate Okaris is dead, but Markius did manage to save <FirstName>...
<StartAction>[Suddenly, the imprisoned man speaks.]</Start> Markius? Markius? Is that you? I can scarcely see a thing through this magical shield!
Yes, Harkon, I am here, along with <FullName>. I managed to save <him/her>... but I fear I was too late to save Okaris...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>
<StartAction>[This man seems to be quite occupied at the moment, and pays you little heed.]</Start>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PRELUDE" >>
Why are you imprisoned here?
The Crimson Prophet is here? Where?
How do you know this?
What is this relic, anyway?
How do I know I can trust you?
How can I free you from this prison?
Hmph! I may just leave you in that cage!
I'll see what I can do...
How do you know my name?
I'm fine, though my father was not so lucky.
